bioghist.p: The object of the Philadelphia Education Society was to "educate young men for the ministry upon the principles and in conformity with the constitution of the American Education Society." The Philadelphia Education Society was a regional auxiliary of the Presbyterian Education Society (originally the Education Society of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A.), itself an auxiliary of the Board of Education of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the Board of Directors of the Philadelphia Education Society, 1854-1905. (Records prior to September 1854 were destroyed by fire.) The volume includes the constitution of the Society, records of appropriations to scholars at various colleges and seminaries, records of the election of officers, reports from committees, and brief memorials of deceased members. The volume also includes minutes from a 1910 special meeting related to the dissolution of the Society and the transfer of remaining moneys to the Board of Education of the Presbyterian Church in the USA.
